meanings.definition: A rapid succession of sharp, knocking sounds.
meanings.sent1: The ratatat of the drumsticks echoed through the room.
meanings.sent2: I heard a ratatat on the window as the hailstorm began.
meanings.sent3: The ratatat of the typewriter made the writer feel like a musician.
meanings.sent4: The ratatat of the fireworks lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The ratatat of the machine gun filled the air with intensity.

meanings.definition: To make a rapid succession of sharp, knocking sounds.
meanings.sent1: He likes to ratatat on the table with his fingers when he's nervous.
meanings.sent2: The woodpecker began to ratatat on the old tree trunk.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they tried to ratatat on the classroom desks quietly.
meanings.sent4: Her heart started to ratatat in her chest when she saw the surprise party.
meanings.sent5: The rain started to ratatat on the roof, creating a soothing rhythm.
